message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to discuss the possibility of selling you this amazing product. I believe it's a great fit for you, and I'm willing to offer it to you for $11,000.
Thank you for the offer, Alice.  While I appreciate your enthusiasm, $11,000 is a bit too high for my budget. I'm willing to pay $9,500 for the product.  Let me know what you think.
Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand that $11,000 is a bit steep for you, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $10,500.
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $10,500 is still a bit out of my range.  I'm comfortable with my previous offer of $9,500.  Let's see if we can make this work.
I understand that you're sticking to your original offer, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll sell the product to you for $10,000, which is the lowest price I'm willing to accept.

Alice, I appreciate your flexibility. While $10,000 is a step in the right direction, I'm still hoping for a price closer to my budget. I'm willing to pay $9,000 for the product.  Let's see if we can close this deal.

Bob, I understand that you're trying to get the best deal, but I'm getting a bit concerned that we're getting too far apart. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my original price. I'll sell the product to you for $9,750.
Alice, I appreciate your continued willingness to negotiate.  I'm willing to go up to $9,250, but that's the highest I can go at this point.  Let's see if we can find common ground.

Bob, I understand that you're trying to get the best deal, but I'm getting close to my minimum acceptable price. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my original price. I'll sell the product to you for $9,500.
